page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT IN CHATBURN
page.content: Employment in the area can be class- ified as agricultural,commercial and service industry.Agriculture is the main land use and comprises small farm steads on the lower slopes of Wadd'ton Fell mainly given over to milk and fat lamb production with a very small amount of beef production.Employment per farm is typically 2\3 persons throughout the year.Commercial employ- ment is to be found principally in two factories-one at Grindleton producing children's wear and employing 80 people the other at Chatburn employing 140 people and producing textile products for the pharm.industry.Service industr- ies comprise a number of small village shops, hotels and a Country Club all providing local employment for increa- sing numbers of tourists.The industrial relations climate is stable and unem- ployment is 5.2% in the Ribble Valley.
